dt: {bc}any of a family (Procaviidae) of small ungulate mammals of Africa and the Middle East characterized by thickset body with short legs and ears and rudimentary tail, feet with soft pads and broad nails, and teeth of which the molars resemble those of the rhinoceros and the incisors those of rodents

shortdef: any of a family (Procaviidae) of small ungulate mammals of Africa and the Middle East characterized by thickset body with short legs and ears and rudimentary tail, feet with soft pads and broad nails, and teeth of which the molars resemble those of the rhinoceros and the incisors those of rodents —called also coney, dassie

dt: {bc}a diurnal, terrestrial {d_link|hyrax|hyrax} ({it}Procavia capensis{/it}) of Africa and the Middle East that frequents rocky, scrub-covered areas

dt.t: Also residing in the kopje are {it}rock hyraxes{/it}—small, social mammals that look like rodents but are more closely related to elephants, as their tusklike incisors attest.

dt: There are several subspecies of rock hyraxes that are sometimes regarded as distinct species. The rock hyrax of the Middle East is the {wi}coney{/wi} of the Old Testament.

shortdef: a diurnal, terrestrial hyrax (Procavia capensis) of Africa and the Middle East that frequents rocky, scrub-covered areas
